context_blocks.name: VIB3+ System Overview
context_blocks.content:
# VIB3+ System Overview

VIB3+ is a shader-based visualization system for creating animated backgrounds, artistic effects, and immersive web interfaces.

## Two Main Repositories

| Repo | Purpose | URL |
|------|---------|-----|
| **vib3-plus-engine** | Complete deployed app | https://github.com/Domusgpt/vib3-plus-engine |
| **vib34d-vib3plus** | npm SDK for custom apps | https://github.com/Domusgpt/vib34d-vib3plus |

## Live Application
https://domusgpt.github.io/vib3-plus-engine/

## Four Visualization Systems
- **Faceted**: 2D geometric patterns
- **Quantum**: 3D lattice/interference effects
- **Holographic**: Audio-reactive dimensional blending
- **Polychora**: Polytope-inspired complex patterns

## 24 Geometries Per System
Formula: `geometry = coreIndex * 8 + baseIndex`
- Base (0-7): Tetrahedron, Hypercube, Sphere, Torus, Klein, Fractal, Wave, Crystal
- Cores (0-2): Base, Hypersphere warp, Hypertetra warp

context_blocks.name: Choose Your Approach
context_blocks.content:
# Choose Your VIB3+ Integration Approach

## Task: Simple Embedding / Background
**Use: Iframe with URL parameters**
```html
<iframe src="https://domusgpt.github.io/vib3-plus-engine/?system=faceted&geometry=1&hue=200"></iframe>
```
No code to write. Configure via URL. Done.

## Task: Customize UI / Add Features
**Use: Clone vib3-plus-engine**
```bash
git clone https://github.com/Domusgpt/vib3-plus-engine
```
Modify index.html directly. Everything is inline.

## Task: Build Custom App / React / Vue / XR
**Use: npm SDK**
```bash
npm install vib34d-xr-quaternion-sdk
```
Import modules, build with your framework.

## Decision Matrix
| Need | Approach |
|------|----------|
| Just a background | Iframe |
| Modify controls/UI | Clone repo |
| React/Vue component | SDK |
| XR/AR integration | SDK |
| Mobile app | SDK (Flutter support) |

context_blocks.name: vib3-plus-engine Architecture
context_blocks.content:
# vib3-plus-engine Architecture

**Repo**: https://github.com/Domusgpt/vib3-plus-engine

Everything is in index.html - a self-contained ~42KB application.

## Module Stack (load order matters)

**Phase 1 - Init:**
- url-params.js - URL parameter handler
- gallery-preview-fix.js

**Phase 2 - Core:**
- audio-engine.js
- ui-handlers.js
- gallery-manager.js, gallery-modal.js
- bezel-tabs.js, geometry-tabs.js
- device-tilt.js

**Phase 3 - Enhancement:**
- ui-fixes.js, geometric-icons.js
- global-shortcuts.js
- performance-optimizer.js
- state-manager.js

**Phase 4 - App:**
- app.js (VIB34DApp class)

## Engine Classes
- VIB34DIntegratedEngine (faceted)
- QuantumEngine
- RealHolographicSystem
- NewPolychoraEngine

## Key Global Functions
```javascript
window.switchSystem(system)     // Change rendering system
window.selectGeometry(index)    // Switch geometry (0-23)
window.updateParameter(id, val) // Update any parameter
window.randomizeAll()           // Randomize everything
window.toggleAudio()            // Enable/disable audio
```

## Global State
```javascript
window.currentSystem       // 'faceted' | 'quantum' | 'holographic' | 'polychora'
window.userParameterState  // All current parameter values
window.moduleReady         // true when initialization complete
window.geometries          // Geometry names per system
```

context_blocks.name: SDK Architecture
context_blocks.content:
# vib34d-xr-quaternion-sdk Architecture

**Repo**: https://github.com/Domusgpt/vib34d-vib3plus

## Installation
```bash
npm install vib34d-xr-quaternion-sdk
```

## Source Structure (src/)
```
core/           # Main SDK (~180KB)
  AdaptiveSDK.js          # Entry point
  PolychoraSystem.js      # Central engine (40KB)
  Visualizer.js           # Rendering (32KB)
  ReactivityManager.js    # Input/state (29KB)
  Parameters.js           # Config (15KB)
  CanvasManager.js        # Canvas ops (7KB)
  quaternions/            # 4D math

geometry/       # Shape calculations
holograms/      # Holographic system
math/           # Math utilities
physics/        # Physics simulation
quantum/        # Quantum system
ui/             # UI components
vib3plus/       # Platform core
```

## Main Imports
```javascript
import SDK from 'vib34d-xr-quaternion-sdk';
import { quaternionModule } from 'vib34d-xr-quaternion-sdk/quaternion';
import { polychoraModule } from 'vib34d-xr-quaternion-sdk/polychora';
import { sensorsModule } from 'vib34d-xr-quaternion-sdk/sensors';
```

## SDK vs Deployed App
- SDK: Build custom apps, requires bundler
- Deployed App: Use as-is, iframe or clone

context_blocks.name: All Parameters
context_blocks.content:
# VIB3+ Parameters

## 6D Rotation
| Parameter | Range | Description |
|-----------|-------|-------------|
| rot4dXY | -6.28 to 6.28 | XY plane |
| rot4dXZ | -6.28 to 6.28 | XZ plane |
| rot4dYZ | -6.28 to 6.28 | YZ plane |
| rot4dXW | -6.28 to 6.28 | XW plane (4D) |
| rot4dYW | -6.28 to 6.28 | YW plane (4D) |
| rot4dZW | -6.28 to 6.28 | ZW plane (4D) |

## Visual
| Parameter | Range | Default |
|-----------|-------|--------|
| gridDensity | 5-100 | 15 |
| morphFactor | 0-2 | 1.0 |
| chaos | 0-1 | 0.2 |
| speed | 0.1-3 | 1.0 |

## Color
| Parameter | Range | Default |
|-----------|-------|--------|
| hue | 0-360 | 200 |
| saturation | 0-1 | 0.8 |
| intensity | 0-1 | 0.5 |

## Geometry
| Parameter | Range | Description |
|-----------|-------|-------------|
| geometry | 0-23 | coreIndex * 8 + baseIndex |

## Base Shapes
0=Tetrahedron, 1=Hypercube, 2=Sphere, 3=Torus, 4=Klein, 5=Fractal, 6=Wave, 7=Crystal

## Core Modifiers
0=Base (0-7), 1=Hypersphere (8-15), 2=Hypertetra (16-23)

context_blocks.name: Audio Reactivity
context_blocks.content:
# Audio Reactivity

Best with `system=holographic`.

## Frequency Bands
| Band | Affects | Intensity |
|------|---------|--------|
| Bass | rot4dXW, Color | 3.0x |
| Mid | rot4dYW, Geometry | 2.5x |
| Treble | rot4dZW, Movement | 2.0x |

## Sensitivity Levels
- LOW: 30%
- MED: 100%
- HIGH: 200%

## Enable via URL
```
?audioEnabled=true
```

## Enable via Code
```javascript
window.toggleAudio();
```

## Audio Matrix (UI)
The deployed app has a reactivity tab with toggles for:
- Which frequency bands affect which parameters
- Per-system audio mapping configuration
